sluce2.landscape
Class RasterRepository

java.lang.Object
  sluce2.landscape.RasterRepository
Direct Known Subclasses:
Template
public class RasterRepository
extends java.lang.Object

A repository for raster data.

This class encapsulates a raster layer group, made up of 0 or more sub-groups. The HELIA GIS java library is used to load, access and manipulate raster data layers. @see hegis.umn.edu A rasters are loaded through a raster descriptor xml file. An optional layer group name may be specified.

Author:
Meghan Hutchins

getLayer

public umn.geog.helia.landscape.LandscapeLayer getLayer(java.lang.String layerName)
Note: Some files may have multiple layers with the same name, but nested within different groups. Use this method if you are certain that there is only one layer with the given name.

Returns:
The particular landscape layer associated with the given layer group name.

saveLayerTo

public boolean saveLayerTo(umn.geog.helia.landscape.LandscapeLayer layer,
                           java.lang.String pathToFolder,
                           boolean includeTimestamp,
                           boolean includeTickNbr)
Save the given raster layer to a new file. Optional timestamp and/or tick number may be included in the name of the saved file.

Parameters:
dataLayer - The raster layer object
includeTimestamp - True if the time-stamp should be included in the filename, false otherwise
includeTickNbr - True if the tick number should be included in the filename, false otherwise
Returns:
Success or failure. If the layer has not been changed, it will not be saved.
